description: Coverage from Kingspan Stadium as Ulster host Stormers in round 14 of the United Rugby Championship.
title: Ulster vs Stormers - United Rugby Championship
title_page: Ulster vs Stormers - United Rugby Championship - BBC Sport
maintext:
Full-time
Ulster 38-34 Stormers
Phew!
Ulster hang on at the end to gain a superb bonus-point win.
Six tries in total and a phenomonal comeback after trailing 17-0 early-on.
The visitors will be happy to collect two points with four home games remaining.
Post
Ulster 38-34 Stormers
Ulster win the lineout and enter the Stormers 22.
But wait. They give away another penalty and the Stormers clear to halfway where they will have the lineout.
30 seconds remain.
Converted Try - Ulster 38-34 Stormers
Evan Roos (try), Sacha Feinberg-Mngomezulu (conv.) - 75mins
My goodness what a finish we have!
The endless pressure pays off for the Stormers and it is Evan Roos who barges over from close range for his second of the night.
Sacha Feinberg-Mngomezulu scores with the conversion and it is a huge five minutes ahead for everyone.
Post
Ulster 38-27 Stormers
Stormers take a scrum five-metres out.
Ulster look like they have a dramatic interception, but play is called back for another Stormers penalty within the Ulster 22. The away side need to score if they have any hope of snatching victory.
Sin-bin
Ulster 38-27 Stormers
And it is found to be an unlawful act.
Substitute Harry Sheridan is given a yellow card and won't be back.
Post
Ulster 38-27 Stormers
The Stormers get within six inches of the Ulster line but knock it on at the base of the ruck after Evan Roos places it backwards.
However, the referee is looking to see if Ulster interfered there with the ball illegally.
Post
Ulster 38-27 Stormers
The Stormers are still looking hungry here as they attack into the Ulster 22.
Advantage is being played for the visitors.
Converted try - Ulster 38-27 Stormers
Stewart Moore (try), Nathan Doak (conv.) - 66mins
It is try number six of the evening for Ulster and the best of the bunch.
Mike Lowry gathers a kick outside his 22, before scorching dowmn the right flank.
The ball then goes inside to NIck Timoney, then Nathan Doak and then Moore who dashes over beside the uprights. Deadly attacking.
Nathan Doak bangs over the extra two.
Converted Try - Ulster 31-27 Stormers
Willie Engelbrecht (try), Sacha Feinberg-Mngomezulu (conv.) - 62mins
That poll may just get a little closer after that try.
The Stormers finding success down the Ulster blind-side before swapping back in-field unleasing the substitute Engelbrecht who darts in beside the posts.
Sacha Feinberg-Mngomezulu adds the extras, game on.
Post
Ulster 31-20 Stormers
Ulster are really targeting Evan Roos around the ruck.
The imposing number-eight was on fire in the opening half-an-hour but seems to be swarmed everytime he gets the ball by numerous defenders in white.
Poll time
Ulster 31-20 Stormers
We have seen one comeback so far this evening, is a second possible? Can the Stormers still get the win?
Thumbs up for an Ulster win and thumbs down for a Stormers victory.
Get voting!
Converted Try - Ulster 31-20 Stormers
Zac Ward (try), Jack Murphy (conv.) - 55mins
Superb score from the hosts and their fifth of the evening.
Jacob Stockdale bursts through the midfield before offloading to the right flank to the flying-win Ward who sprints over. Super stuff from Ulster.
Jack Murphy hits the conversion.
